groups.name: Things you wear on your head

easy.notes: Category explanations: 1) animals with four legs. 2) furniture you can sit on. 3) sources of light. 4) headwear. Near-miss temptation avoided by keeping each item clearly fitting only its group.

groups.name: Things in a kitchen you can stir

medium.notes: Category explanations: 1) words starting with re- (re- prefix). 2) common compound words starting with sun- as a prefix. 3) geometric shapes with four equal sides or visual symmetry; note that some terms can be debated, but square is the classic. 4) kitchen tools used for stirring or mixing. Near-miss temptation: items like 'beat' could feel related to kitchen, but not a tool; only the listed stirring tools fit.

groups.name: Words that become new words with -er suffix
Modes of transportation that carry people
Things that reflect light or color in small mirrors

hard.notes: Category explanations: 1) abstract links using animal traits as metaphor (e.g., wise owl, swift dolphin) to form a unifying theme; near-miss temptation would be picking animals that share obvious literal connections rather than metaphorical ones. 2) Words that can form new meaningful words by adding -er (e.g., paint -> painter is not in list; here, focus on the potential transformation, but use items that clearly illustrate the suffix rule). 3) Vehicles that carry people; distinct, non-overlapping modes. 4) Objects that reflect light or color in small mirrors; ensure each item is a typical reflective object. Near-miss temptation avoided by ensuring each item only fits its intended group.
